6.) Based on the 'standr homepage' image:
I built standr dex site platform. Full suite hyper rich luxury premium site although i'm not yet done building it. it will be linked to the eosifinance.org site or now that i'm still running it locally, on http://localhost:5173/
Because i didn't want to bring all the remaining parts of that standr dex here, i asked codex 5.3 to extract only the standr homepage in such a way that i can export it to my 'eosinov2024' folder which contains this my eosifinance.org source code files. I then asked codex to go to the 'frontend-pages-export' folder to see how i built it and then try to recreate it for me with some little modifications. It did but there seems to be some unfinished stuff which we will be finishing soon.
a.) if you check the 'standr l1' image, theres many difference between 'standr l1' image and 'standr homepage' image. for example, the standr icon which is visible at on the 'standr l1' image while on the 'standr homepage' image, it's not visible or there's no proper standr icon even though there's proper standr icon called 'standr-icon.svg' located at 'frontend-pages-export/public/standr-icon.svg' . b.) I don't like how the 'Join STANDR DEX waitlist' on white background and green colour is. it makes it look so cheap, quack and low quality. I was thinking if you can come up with something luxury on how projects, fintech sites, web3 sites always present their join waitlist notification there because how i made codex to build it is it will let users that click it be taken down to the section were they will have to input their email and optional x acct. so still like it like that.
c.) that 'Explore Web App' and 'Open in Telegram', i will like you to make it in such a way that for now since i'm not yet done with building the standr site and it's supposed to have the link that leads the user to a new opened tab for the standr site, as well as the telegram supposed to lead to the standr telegram bot, but since these are not yet ready, i want that when a user tries to click it, it will indicate that it's unclickable with a popout notification for them to join the waitlist. the popout notification only appears if the user moves the mouse near the  'Explore Web App' and 'Open in Telegram' and if the mouse is moved away from these two buttons ('Explore Web App' and 'Open in Telegram'), the pop-out should disappear.
d.) The Home at the Header should always take the user back to the main site which should be eosifinance.org but since i'm still running it locally for now, should be to the local host for example,  to http://localhost:5173/
